children.name: decide
children.definition: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments →decision:
examples: Has anything been decided yet?

children.name: decide to do sth/ not to do sth
examples: Tina’s decided to go to Rome for her holidays.
If you decide not to accept our offer, let me know.

children.name: decide (that)
examples: It was decided that four hospitals should close.

children.name: decide who/what/whether etc
examples: I can’t decide whether I like him or not.
People have a right to decide how to spend their own money.

children.name: decide between something
examples: A meeting was called to decide between the three candidates.

children.name: decide against/in favour of (doing) sth
examples: He eventually decided against telling her.
After a long discussion, they decided in favour of(= chose )the older applicant.
For a second he thought about using his gun, but decided against it.
I was so tired that I decided against going to the party after all.

children.name: decide for yourself(= make your own decision )
examples: You must decide for yourself.
The trainees decide among themselves what programs to take.
you decidespoken used to tell sb to decidetùy bạn quyết định.
I don’t mind which restaurant we go to. You decide.

children.name: make up your mind
children.definition: to finally decide that you will definitely do something, after thinking about it.Make up your mindis less formal thandecideand is mainly used in spoken English: quyết định

children.name: make your mind up
examples: ▪ You’ll have to make your mind up soon, or there won’t be any tickets left.

children.name: make up your mind (that)
examples: ▪ She’s finally made up her mind that she wants to study Law.

children.name: make up your mind to do sth
examples: ▪ John had made up his mind to forget the past and make a fresh start.

children.name: make up your mind what/ how/ which etc
examples: ▪ I couldn’t make up my mind which college I wanted to go to.

children.name: choose to do sth
children.definition: choose to decide to do sth because you want to,without worryingabout what other people think– especially when this is different from what people expect or tell you to do: :quyết định
examples: choose to do sth
More and more young couples today are choosing not to marry
I told him to drive more slowly, but he chose to ignore my advice

children.name: resolve
children.definition: to decide that you willdefinitelydo something and willnotchangeyour mind about it, especially because you think it will be better for you, or because of your past experiences: quyết định

children.name: resolve to do sth
examples: I resolved to keep quiet about what I had heard, since it would only cause trouble.
After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.

children.name: resolve that
examples: Mary resolved that she would stop smoking.

children.name: come down on
children.definition: come down in favour ofUK /come down in favor ofUS  to decide finally to support one plan, argument etc instead of another – used especially about groups of people: ra quyết định ủng hộ, quyết định theo phe
examples: Following a heated debate, the House of Commons came down in favour of the treaty.
The Senate came down in favor of the appointment of Judge Thomas to the US Supreme Court.
Eight of the ten committee members came down in favour of the changes.

children.name: take it into your head to do sth
children.definition: if sb takes it into their head to do sth, they suddenly decide to do sth that you think is stupid or strange: định rằng, muốn rằng
examples: He took it into his head to borrow his Dad’s car without asking.
For some reason they took it into their heads to go swimming at midnight.

children.name: decision
children.definition: a choice or judgment that you make after a period of discussion or thought:
examples: Do you ever wonder if you made the right decision?

children.name: make a decisionto decide after thinking carefully about something, especially about something that is very important :
examples: They made a decision not to have children.

children.name: take a decisionBritish English
children.definition: make an important or formal decision
examples: I fully accept the decision taken by the committee.

children.name: reach/come to/arrive at a decision
children.definition: to officially decide about something important after discussing and carefully considering it - used especially about groups of people
examples: We hope they will reach their decision as soon as possible.

children.name: regret a decision
children.definition: wish you had not made a particular decision
examples: I was already regretting my decision to go on holiday with him.

children.name: reconsider a decision
children.definition: think about changing a decision you have made
examples: He said he wasn't prepared to reconsider his decision.

children.name: reverse a decision
children.definition: change a decision
examples: They want him to reverse his decision to quit.

children.name: overrule/overturn a decision
children.definition: officially change a decision by another person or group
examples: A director of the company had overruled that decision.

children.name: postpone a decision
children.definition: not make a decision until later
examples: The government has postponed its decision about when to hold the election.

children.name: an important decision
examples: My father made all the important decisions.

children.name: a big decision
children.definition: an important decision
examples: Marriage is a big decision.

children.name: a major decision
children.definition: very important
examples: The government now has some major decisions to make.

children.name: a difficult/hard/tough decision
examples: In the end I took the difficult decision to retire early.

children.name: a good decision
examples: It was a good decision to change the name of the product.

children.name: a bad decision
examples: I think he made a bad decision.

children.name: the right decision
examples: She chose to study Engineering and it was definitely the right decision.

children.name: the wrong decision
examples: I thought I'd made the wrong decision marrying Jeff.

children.name: a conscious/deliberate decision
children.definition: one that you have thought about clearly
examples: Belinda had made a conscious decision to have a baby.

children.name: a clear/firm decision
children.definition: a definite one
examples: It's now time to come to a clear decision on this.

children.name: a final decision
children.definition: one that will not be changed
examples: The council will make a final decision in four months.

children.name: a snap decision
children.definition: one that you make extremely quickly
examples: Police officers often have to make snap decisions on how to act.

children.name: a controversial decision
children.definition: that people disagree about
examples: The history of the law is full of controversial decisions.

children.name: a hasty decision
children.definition: one that you make without enough thought
examples: Don't let yourself be forced into making hasty decisions.

children.name: a joint decision
children.definition: one that two people make together
examples: Jo and I made a joint decision that we should separate.

children.name: a collective decision
children.definition: one that a number of people make together
examples: Society should take collective decisions about individual rights and responsibilities.

children.name: decision to do sth
examples: She refused to discuss her decision to quit the group.

children.name: decision about/on
examples: We finally came to a firm decision on the matter.

children.name: decision as to which/whether/who etc
examples: Viewers make the final decision as to who should be eliminated from the competition.

children.name: sb’s decision is finalcannot be changed
examples: The referee’s decision is final.
The judges’decisionisfinal.
I want to think about it a bit longer before I make a decision.

children.name: resolution
children.definition: a formal decision or statement agreed on by a group of people, especially after a vote: nghị quyết

children.name: pass/approve a resolution
examples: The Security Council passed a resolution condemning the country’s aggression.

children.name: adopt a resolution
children.definition: pass it
examples: The resolution was adopted by 12 votes to none.

children.name: reject a resolution
examples: The National Assembly rejected the resolution.

children.name: propose/introduce/put forward a resolution
examples: The resolution was proposed by the chairman of the committee.

children.name: table a resolution
children.definition: officially propose it
examples: Siddall tabled a resolution asking for the Board’s approval of the Five Year Business Plan.

children.name: vote on a resolution
examples: Are there any comments you wish to make before we vote on this resolution?

children.name: a resolution calling for something
examples: We support the EU resolution calling for a ban on the use of these fishing nets.

children.name: a resolution condemning something
examples: The UN Security Council tabled a resolution condemning the invasion.

children.name: aresolution calling fora ban on dumping nuclear waste
examples: They have failed to comply with the resolution.

children.name: when sb has the responsibility or right to decide
it is up to sb
children.definition: especiallyspokenif you say it’s up to someone, you mean that that person should make the decision about something, and no one else: tùy vào ai
examples: ▪ ‘Where would you like to go this evening?’ ‘It’s up to you - it’s your birthday.’
it is up to sb what/ when/ whether etc
▪ It’s up to them what they do with their money.
it is entirely up to sb
▪ I think you should take the job, but of course it’s entirely up to you.

children.name: be for sb to decide
children.definition: use this when onlyonepersonorgrouphas the right or authority to make a decision about sth important: ai đó có quyền quyết định
examples: We cannot say if he’s guilty or not. That is for the court to decide.

children.name: it is for sb to decide what/whether/when etc
examples: It’s for you to decide whether you go to university or not - not your parents.

children.name: the ball is in your court
children.definition: if the ball is in your court, it is your turn to make a decision and other people are waiting for that decision: quyết định nằm trong tay bạn
examples: I’ve told you what I think of your idea -- the ball’s in your court now.
The terrorists had made their demands clear and the ball was in the government’s court.

children.name: rest with
children.definition: if a decision rests with sb, they have the authority to decide what should be done: tùy vào
examples: The committee has made certain recommendations, but the final decision rests with the President.
Responsibility for any military operation always rested with the commander.
The final decision rests with the President.

children.name: good or not at making decisions
indecisive
children.definition: unable to make clear decisions or choicesOPP decisive: thiếu quyết đoán
examples: I’m sorry to be so indecisive, but can I let you know tomorrow?
An indecisive commander is unlikely to win the confidence of his men.
a weak and indecisive leader
indecisiveness[U]
The report criticized the chairman for his indecisiveness and lack of leadership.

children.name: decisive
children.definition: sb who is decisive can make decisionsfirmlyandconfidently, without needing too much time to talk about them or think about them: dứt khoát, kiên quyết, quyết đoán
examples: We are still waiting for Jim to make up his mind. I wish he would be more decisive.
This country needs strong, decisive leadership.

children.name: can’t decide
children.definition: /can’t make up your mind to not be able to make a decision: không thể quyết định được
examples: ▪ What colour are you going to paint your room?‘ ’I can’t make up my mind."
can’t decide what/ whether/ how etc
▪ It was time to go and I still couldn’t decide what to wear.
▪ We can’t decide whether to go to Greece or Italy this year.

children.name: dither
children.definition: to keep changing your mind - use this when you think sb isweakorstupidbecause they cannot decide about sth: do dự, chần chừ
examples: Stop dithering and make up your mind.

children.name: dither over
examples: Marcia was still upstairs, dithering over what she should pack.

children.name: be in two minds
children.definition: to be unable to decide whether or not to do a particular thing: không thể quyết định, phân vân

children.name: be in two minds about
examples: My parents want me to study medicine, but I’m still in two minds about it.
Des was in two minds about buying the car, but the salesman persuaded him.

children.name: be in two minds whether to do sth
examples: I’m in two minds about whether to get a dog or not - it’s such a responsibility.

children.name: when sb has not yet decided
have not decided
children.definition: /have not made up your mindvẫn chưa quyết định
examples: ▪ ‘Are you selling your house?’ ‘We haven’t decided yet.’
have not decided what/ how/ whether etc
▪ I haven’t decided what I’m going to get my brother for his birthday.
▪ Steve hasn’t made up his mind whether he’s in favour of the idea or not.

children.name: undecided
children.definition: be  sb who is undecided has not yet decided about sth, especially sth important:
examples: lưỡng lự
▪ ‘Is Fred going to take the job?’ ‘He’s still undecided.’
be undecided about/ as to
▪ A third of the voters remain undecided about how they will vote.
be undecided what/ which/ whether etc
▪ He hesitated, undecided whether to go or stay.

children.name: keep your options open
children.definition: to deliberately avoid or delay making an important decision so that you are free to decide later: chưa vội quyết định
examples: New technology’s getting cheaper and better all the time, so if I were you I’d keep my options open for a while.
Some presidential candidates keep their options open about policy issues in order to avoid losing any voters.

children.name: a toss of a coin
children.definition: when you throw a coin in the air and guess which side will land facing upward as a way ofdeciding something

children.name: spin a coin
children.definition: to make a coin turn around and around on its edge so that someone can guess which side will land facing upwards
examples: _Let's spin a coin to decide who'll have the first turn.

children.name: heads or tails?
children.definition: asked before you throw a coin into the air and want
examples: someone else to guess which side it will land on

children.name: toss
children.definition: verbCOINgieo tiền, tung tiền

children.name: win/lose the toss
children.definition: đoánđúng /sai vị trí đồng tiền
examples: to guess correctly/wrongly which side of a coin will be facing up when it lands on the ground after being thrown

children.name: to decide the result of sth
decide
children.definition: to be the reason or situation that makes a particular result happen: quyết định
examples: The weather decided the outcome of the cricket match.
Tim's mistake decided the game (= caused him to lose) .
It was the penalty kick that decided the match.

children.name: decide sb to do sth
examples: The look he gave her decided her not to ask.

children.name: decisive
children.definition: an action, event etc that is decisive has a big effect on the way that sth develops: mang tính quyết định

children.name: decisive factor/effect/influence etc
examples: Women canplay a decisive rolein the debate over cloning.

children.name: decisive action/steps
examples: We willtake decisive stepstowards political union with Europe.

children.name: deciding
children.definition: a deciding event or action is more important than the rest because the final result, decision or choice is changed by it: quyết định
examples: The environmental argument was a decidingfactor.
The chairperson always has the decidingvote.
Glennon scored the deciding goal in the final minute of the match.
Taxes could bethe deciding factorfor millions of floating voters.

children.name: set
children.definition: verbsetting,set,setFIXbố trí, sắp đặt

children.name: fix
children.definition: verbARRANGEđịnh;ấn định; quy định;thu xếp

children.name: determine
children.definition: verbDECIDE quyết định

children.name: in the balance
children.definition: If a situation is  it has reached a stage where it will soon be decided oneway or another
examples: _The gamehungin the balance until the last minute when an exciting point decided it.
